noun.description: A tube-shaped sac attached to and opening into the lower end of the large intestine in humans and some other mammals.
A section or table of additional matter at the end of a book or document.
examples: a list of such activities was published as an appendix to the report
outline answers may be found in Appendix 2

origin: Mid 16th century (in appendix (sense 2)): from Latin, from appendere hang upon (see append). appendix (sense 1) dates from the early 17th century.
